Class RobotJoints

java.lang.Object
  RobotJoints

public class RobotJoints
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains the Denavit-Hartenberg representation of the UMI-RTX robot arm. For a complete description of the Denavit-Hartenberg notation see chapter 5 of "An Introduction to Robotics for the Computer Sciences" by Leo Dorst, better known "the syllabus".

As a reference here's the result of printing an instantiation of this class:
joint 0 [zed: theta 90.0 alpha 0.0 a 67.5 d 1082.0 ECmin -3478.0 ECmax 0.0 Rmin 0.0 Rmax 925.0]
joint 1 [shoulder: theta 0.0 alpha 0.0 a 253.5 d 95.0 ECmin -2630.0 ECmax 2630.0 Rmin -90.0 Rmax 90.0]
joint 2 [elbow: theta 0.0 alpha 0.0 a 253.5 d 80.0 ECmin -2630.0 ECmax 2206.0 Rmin -180.0 Rmax 151.0]
joint 3 [yaw: theta 0.0 alpha -90.0 a 0.0 d 0.0 ECmin -1071.0 ECmax 1071.0 Rmin -110.0 Rmax 110.0]
joint 4 [pitch: theta 0.0 alpha 90.0 a 0.0 d 0.0 ECmin -2642.0 ECmax 108.0 Rmin -98.0 Rmax 4.0]
joint 5 [roll: theta 0.0 alpha 0.0 a 0.0 d 189.0 ECmin -3560.0 ECmax 4882.0 Rmin -132.0 Rmax 181.0]
joint 6 [gripper: theta 0.0 alpha 0.0 a 0.0 d 0.0 ECmin -30.0 ECmax 1200.0 Rmin 0.0 Rmax 90.0]

Constructor Detail

RobotJoints

public RobotJoints()
Sole constructor. It set all values of all joints of the UMI-RTX robot.

Method Detail

get

public RobotJoints.Joint get(int i)
The joints are ordered according to the Denavit-Hartenberg convention.

Parameters:
i - ranges on [0,6].
Returns:
the i'th joint.

get

public RobotJoints.Joint get(java.lang.String joint)
Gets a joint based on its name. If an illegal joint name is passed a NullPointerException will be thrown.

Parameters:
joint - is either "zed", "shoulder", "elbow", "yaw", "pitch", "roll" or "gripper".
Returns:
the requested joint

correctCartesian

public static void correctCartesian(java.util.Vector p)
Corrects for errors in the robot arm by adjusting the GripperPositions in p. Call this method once before calculating the Joint associated to the GripperPositions in p. The arm configuration is derived from the position of the arm, i.e.: x < 0 gives left arm configuration, else right arm configuration.

Parameters:
p - vector of GripperPositions

correctCartesian

public static void correctCartesian(GripperPosition pos)
Corrects for errors in the robot arm by adjusting a GripperPosition. The arm configuration is derived from the position of the arm, i.e.: x < 0 gives left arm configuration, else right arm configuration.

Parameters:
pos - one GripperPositions

correctCartesian

public static void correctCartesian(GripperPosition pos,
                                    int armConfig)
Corrects for errors in the robot arm by adjusting a GripperPosition. The arm configuration can be given, giving some more flexibility.

Parameters:
pos - one GripperPositions
armConfig - 0 means LEFT configuration, 1 means RIGHT configuration

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Convert the complete Denavit-Hartenberg representation of the UMI-RTX robot to a string.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A string consisting of as many lines as there are joints
